action.action-desc: Mr. Cole (for himself, Mr. LaTurner, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Smith of Nebraska, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Gallagher, Mr. Harris, Mr. Rutherford, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Mann, Ms. Mace, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Calvert, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Mr. Ellzey, and Mr. Steube) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit a State from receiving or using funds or certain donations from private entities for the administration of an election for Federal office, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect American Election Administration Act of 2022.

section.header: Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities

subsection.text: Title III of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21081 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating sections 304 and 305 as sections 305 and 306, respectively; and
by inserting after section 303 the following new section:

section.header: Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities for election administration

subsection.text: A State may not solicit, receive, or expend any payment or donation of funds, property, or personal services from a private entity for the purpose of the administration of an election for Federal office, including any programs with respect to voter education, voter outreach, and voter registration.
This section shall not apply with respect to the acceptance and use by a State of a donation from a private entity of space to be used for a polling place or an early voting site in the State.
Section 401 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21111) is amended by striking and 303 and inserting 303, and 304.
The table of contents of such Act is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating the items relating to sections 304 and 305 as relating to sections 305 and 306, respectively; and
by inserting after the item relating to section 303 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 304. Prohibition against the receipt or use of funds or certain donations from private entities for election administration.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply with respect to the regularly scheduled general election for Federal office held in November 2022 and each succeeding election for Federal office.
